title: New: Mutual Benefit – Auburn Epitaphs
content:
Artwork by Alex Porter

Following their 12” release with Holy Spirits on Father/Daugher Records, Mutual Benefit have been going from strength to strength. From the groups’ New York launch party, to the records blog-studded cast, the blogosphere really has a lot to talk about when it comes to Mutual Benefit. Their new single is due to be released on Kassette Klub, and also features an experimental track by Philip Seymour Hoffman, a track Mutual Benefit easily outshine.

The track, Auburn Epitaphs, is a committed and charming folk gem. It floats with a graceful and sparse sensibility, sounds echoing and bouncing in the angelic yet cavernous space. In terms of genre, it sits gently between folk and benign surf-pop, yet as with all Mutual Benefit releases, it’s better to relax and just let the music transport you. Which is exactly what I’m planning to do.
